sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The control file is a per-host configuration description. It consists of sets of resources with properties including support for complex structures representations such as lists, records, trees and large embedded or referenced objects.

The simplest way to to create the control file is by using a regular editor. You can use one of the many XML editors available or use your favourite text editor with XML support (i.e. Emacs, Vim). However, it is not quite optimal to create the control file manually for large sets of machines and it should only be seen as an interface between the auto-installation engine and the Configuration Management System (CMS). &ProfileIntroPHP;
